education_text.0: His main research areas are      Computational complexity theory complexity theory and      Proof complexity proof complexity, with excursions into      redirect    Programming language semantics programming language semantics,      redirect    Parallel computation parallel computation, and      Artificial intelligence artificial intelligenceCook was granted the      BBVA Foundation Frontiers of Knowledge Award BBVA Foundation Frontiers of Knowledge Award 2015 in the Information and Communication Technologies category  for his important role in identifying what computers can and cannot solve efficiently,  in the words of the jury's citationCook has supervised numerous MSc students, and 36 PhD students have completed their degrees under his supervision
